programme.title: Poker Masters

programme.desc: A homesteader builds a barbed-wire fence to protect his land.

programme.desc: A frontier sheriff resists deputizing his brother.

programme.desc: After finding gold, an elderly miner is attacked by three thugs. He manages to kill two of the crooks before the third one murders him and flees. With the help of fiery rancher Mary Kingman (Kim Hunter), Ward sets out to find the fugitive and the heirs to the old man's treasure.

programme.title: The Last of the Fast Guns

They realize that one man must be marked for death, but they don't know who the target is. The even-tempered town physician, Dr. Luke Canfield (Charles Drake), defends the mysterious assassin, but the other locals aren't so welcoming. They form a mob in an attempt to put Gant in the grave before finds the man he's looking for.

programme.desc: Join comedian Katrina Davis as she shares her observations about coffee shop hygiene and the freedom that comes with discovering your dumbest self.

programme.title: Saul Trujillo: Yolanda
programme.desc: Does Variety's 'top comic to watch look like Selena's murderer? Find out why cruises are terrible and the homeless tent problem isn't what we think.

programme.title: Nikki Carr: I Wish These Were Jokes
programme.desc: The brilliant comedian celebrates her 57th birthday and loss of 100 pounds by launching into hilarious anecdotes about stress, dieting, and life woes.

programme.title: Bill Squire: We're Getting Famous
programme.desc: From the Agora Theater in Cleveland, Ohio, hometown comedy legend Bill Squire's comedy special continues to discover the threads connecting his own childhood to his role as a parent.

programme.title: Bill Squire: Pure BS
programme.desc: The excommunicated Mormon Missionary tackles life's unfairness, absurdities, and controversial topics with his uniquely heartwarming comedic style.

programme.title: Anjelah Johnson: Mahalo & Goodnight
programme.desc: In her fourth stand-up comedy special, Anjelah Johnson dishes on awkward massages, home invasions, spiders, and being a full-grown child.

programme.title: Anjelah Johnson: The Homecoming Show
programme.desc: The comic shares her stories of growing up with a sports enthusiast father who never wanted to pay for athletic training, and other hilarious tales.

programme.title: Iliza Shlesinger: Freezing Hot
programme.desc: The acclaimed Last Comic Standing winner explains how women hate being cold, but love cold weather, and other hilarious observations.

programme.title: Iliza Shlesinger: Over & Over
programme.desc: A hilarious and practical documentary about comedian Iliza Shlesingers preparing for her fourth Netflix special, plus rules of comedy and travel.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Controlled Chaos
programme.desc: The ventriloquist comedian provides fresh, hilarious material with his favorite puppets; Walter, Peanut, and two brand new characters.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: All Over the Map
programme.desc: A comedy set and travelogue by comedian Jeff Dunham as he and his ventriloquists dummies perform globally from Iceland and London to Israel.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: I'm With Cupid
programme.desc: Ventriloquist and stand-up comedian Jeff Dunham performs an all-Valentine's Day-themed special.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Arguing With Myself
programme.desc: Join Jeff and his outspoken felt pals: Walter, Peanut, Jos Jalapeo, Bubba J, and Sweet Daddy Dee for an evening of laughs and observations.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Unhinged in Hollywood
programme.desc: Previously unseen stand-up comedy by Jeff Dunham; sketches that include popular characters; Brad Paisley performs; special appearances by comic Chris Parnell and former UFC champion Chuck Liddell.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Minding the Monsters
programme.desc: The comedian and ventriloquist extraordinaire, along with this felt friends, visits a haunted house where hilarious chaos ensues.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Spark of Insanity
programme.desc: Jeff and his felt friends Walter, Melvin the Superhero Guy, Peanut, and others share their latest and greatest thoughts about our times.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Master Ninja II" (1983) Martial arts. The Master (Lee Van Cleef) searches the United States for his long-lost daughter. From the TV series.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Santa Claus Conquers the Martians" (1964) Science Fiction. Martians kidnap Santa (John Call) and two children.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Giant Spider Invasion" (1975) Cult. Scientist and girlfriend spy car-size mutant spiders; with Steve Brodie, Barbara Hale.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Amanda Reese breaks out in hives and begins to hyperventilate after returning from a Hurricane Katrina relief effort. Dr. G wonders if an infection caused this young woman's untimely death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Paramedics respond to a mother in distress: one of her infant twin girls hasn't woken up. By the time help arrives, it's too late. But there is no apparent cause of death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: While in the process of adopting a five-week-old baby, a mother takes him to work with her. While there, the baby inexplicably obtains a skull fracture while unsupervised.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A retired military officer is found dead in his own backyard during a freak ice storm in San Antonio, Texas.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A 71-year-old man wakes in the middle of the night, gasping for air. Paramedics rush to save him, but it's all in vain: he's dead by the time they arrive. What caused his death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: While in the process of adopting a five-week-old baby, a mother takes him to work with her. While there, the baby inexplicably obtains a skull fracture while unsupervised.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must determine if a teen boy died by taking his own life, but the autopsy leads to a more shocking and tragic conclusion.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Manny Alvarez mysteriously crashes his car into a fence. He dies en route to the hospital, leaving behind a wife and son. It is up to Dr. G to find out what cut this young man's life short.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: In August of 1995, when Dr. G worked in Texas, a pile of human bones was found at a supposedly haunted railroad crossing. Dr. G was able to determine the age but not the sex.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It is 3am and Deputy Torres is cruising a Texas highway when he suddenly spots a crushed pick-up truck along the side of the road. Trapped inside is the lifeless body of 24-year-old Luis Reyes.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An infant and his two-year-old sister are found dead in a house shared by two families. At first, they are believed to have died from either carbon monoxide poisoning or cold medicine overdoses.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Chris Schaffer has not been seen or heard from in five days. Finally, his friends find him dead and decomposed in the driver's seat of his van.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Rusty Updike has asked his ex-wife Vesta on a cruise. The couple haven't seen each other for 15 years but Vesta decides that a cruise with her ex might make for a nice change of pace.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G. has just graduated from medical school and is set to begin her first job as an M.E. in Jacksonville, Florida when a high-profile case challenges her to use her newly acquired skills.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An 82-year-old woman appears to have committed suicide by overdosing on painkillers, but Dr. G finds evidence that suggests that she may have died of a heart attack.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: On a Texas highway, a fire is discovered having burnt three bodies beyond recognition. Dr. G finds bullets in the bodies and determines that they were all shot before being set on fire.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police are driving down the street when a man suddenly jumps in front of their car. They screech to a halt and avoid hitting him, but the man is highly agitated.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When Dr. G receives Lea Conrad's body, she suspects the woman may have died from an antihistamine overdose. Then, Dr. G learns that Lea was being treated for lupus.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: During her career as a medical examiner, Dr. G has autopsied thousands of murder victims. In this episode, Dr. G shares her most memorable case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An employee is found dead in a restaurant kitchen. Clues found near the body include an empty cash register, a knife and a trail of blood splotches leading to a vandalized car in the parking lot.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must figure out if a decomposed body is that of a local missing woman and if she was murdered.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Carol Moleskie agrees to go on a hunting excursion with her husband, Bob. A few hours after they enter the woods, they emerge again, Bob frantically waving down traffic as he carries his bloody wife.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A retired businessman travels from England to Florida to visit his family but dies soon after arriving. Dr. G must now determine what mysteriously killed this healthy man so suddenly.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A 94-year-old woman dies in the hospital after having a convulsion. The case becomes the business of the medical examiner's office when no one will sign her death certificate.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A man is found dead in a motel room due to multiple shotgun wounds. Dr. G proves the scene isn't what it seems.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. Episode 3 sees Gordon travel to the stunning whitewashed mountain village of Gaucin, half an hour from the Costa del Sol. In a series first, Gordon is tackling a brand new up-market start up restaurant, La Granada Divino, it's only been open for 8 weeks but is already heading for disaster. Owned by architect Milan and former model Gina, they have never run a restaurant and have sunk their savings and retirement fund in to the place.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. This final episode in the series takes Gordon to the Costa Blanca and a sleepy village that's home to Quelcutti's restaurant and bar, run by the Quelcutti family. Former London cabbie Del and his wife Sue emigrated to Spain 10 years ago with their three children: Joe, Terry and daughter Ruby. The plan was to retire and live the dream while using their retirement money to set up a business for their kids to run. Unfortunately, the kids are running the business into the ground.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets going on planting herbs in his new herb garden and gives advice on how to divide and move ornamental grasses. Plus, meet the queen of herbs, Jekka McVicar, as she builds a herb garden at the Malvern Show.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: There is work to be done in and around the pond this week, and Monty also begins planting out his dahlias. Adding zing to the month of May is the euphorbia, and Carol Klein visits Oxford Botanic garden to view their extensive collection.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on herbs which will grow happily in shade and has an unusual choice for his summer containers, bananas. Earlier this year, Monty paid a visit to Chatsworth House to find out about the history of the extensive grounds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty adds a touch of the exotic to the damp garden by planting a tree fern, and protects his new soft fruit garden from feathered predators with netting. Also Carol Klein selects hardy geraniums as her June `Plant of the Month'.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: A truck driver from Wakefield with a passion for flowers wants to create a perfect outside space for his girlfriend and burgeoning family, while in Swindon a widow wants to find the best way of turning her bleak patch of green into a cottage garden.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty travels to two corners of the country where the challenges he faces are very different. On the south coast he is presented with a front garden ravaged by salty winds, and in Snowdonia he helps a mountainside garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow sharing a wealth of tips and ideas on how to keep your garden looking good all year long. He tackles some urgent pruning, and reveals some of the projects he's got in store over the coming months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Hellebores, the jewels of the early spring border, come under the spotlight on this show. Monty Don shares his top tips on how to get the best from them. Carol Klein visits a couple who have just moved into a bungalow with a badly neglected garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don explains why he thinks that the once-popular chrysanthemum is worth revisiting and Joe Swift has some helpful suggestions if you're thinking of giving your garden a bit of a spring revamp.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants up a new bed of asparagus and shows us how to lift and divide hostas. On our second visit to South Africa, we explore the conditions that allow agapanthus to thrive in the wild.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty Don breaks ground for his new pond and Carol Klein pays Geoff and Sally Davis another visit in their Somerset garden. Their overgrown shrubs are in need of a jolly good haircut, but they haven't a clue where to begin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the weather begins to warm up, there's plenty to be getting on with in the garden. Monty Don welcomes us to Longmeadow and cracks on with some timely tasks. Including Water Iris Garden, Peonies, Seaside Garden, National Gardening Week.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels from the north west coast of Scotland to the north east coast of England, from historic reconstructions to modern re-inventions. He visits some of the most inhospitable places in the country and finds gardens that are flourishing.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across some of the country's landscapes, heading across the north of England to Northern Ireland. Here, Monty sees the ingenuity, passion and determination of British people to garden and create gardens, no matter what the canvas.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the middle of the country, from Wales to Norfolk. He comes across gardens for gnomes, much-loved, well-tended allotments and extravagant gardens that bankrupted their owners.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the most densely populated part of the country, London and the home counties. He visits some of London's gardens, including a special one on a barge, as well as a beautifully restored garden close to where he grew up in Hampshire.

programme.title: Monty Don's British Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across the south west of the country to visit some of Britain's most exotic gardens. On this journey, Monty also goes to some of the country's most historic gardens, as well as some challenging contemporary ones.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty helps two families create dream gardens that are as much for the children as for the adults. In Doncaster, Nikki and John want a garden full of edible plants and fruit.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Rachel de Thame joins Monty in Longmeadow and adds more medicinal planting to the herb garden, especially those that the bees love. Rachel also investigates how we can aid honey bee conservation and protect the nation's favourite pollinators.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don continues work in his courtyard, where he gives advice on plants which thrive on shady walls, sows root crops in the vegetable garden and catches up on work in his cottage garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets to work in the cutting garden, plants his tomatoes and brings pots of citrus out of the greenhouse and into the garden for the summer. Also, Carol Klein visits another of her gardening heroes, Penelope Hobhouse.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At the height of summer it's time to ensure that fruits and vegetables are given attention to ensure maximum cropping. Monty gives advice on the summer pruning of fruit trees as well as showing how to get the best from tomatoes and chillies. He also recommends plants which will carry on flowering into Autumn.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: There are plans for propagating and planting at Longmeadow when Monty plants up a new bed of irises and takes pelargonium cuttings. Nick brightens up a dull and shady space at the side of a terraced house and gives advice on plants that will thrive.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on how to cut and maintain hedges as well as ideas on growing fruit in pots. Also, Nick Bailey travels to the southern tip of Cornwall to seek out a plant which escaped from our gardens.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Magnolias are the showstoppers of the tree world right now and to celebrate them in all their glory, James Alexander-Sinclair pays Borde Hill Garden in West Sussex, with its collection of magnificent champion trees, a visit.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Everything in the garden is shooting up so it's time to lift and divide perennials and Monty is doing just that with his ornamental grasses. In our third trip to South Africa, we discover where red hot pokers grow in the wild.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As Monty's wildlife garden begins to take shape at Longmeadow, bees are very much at the forefront of his mind. He plants up a nectar-rich border that will attract all sorts of bees and other pollinating insects.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the hanging basket season well and truly underway, Joe Swift meets a florist in Surrey who has perfected the art of kokedama, a modern take on the hanging basket. Houseplants come under the spotlight too.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: For the National Gardens Scheme, over 400 gardens in England and Wales will be opening to the public. Carol Klein visits one of them as they prepare for the big event. At Longmeadow a local beekeeper arrives with a swarm for Monty's new hive.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe casts his expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol focuses on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty faces some of the most surprising plans yet - a Norwegian garden complete with waterfalls to be fashioned out of a tiny back yard in Dorset, and nothing less than a Japanese tea garden to be created out of a patch of ground in Bromley.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As Monty brings in the summer harvest, he gives advice on what to sow to keep the crops coming up to the end of Autumn. Carol Klein visits a woman who is losing her eyesight and gives her recommendations of plants that will be a feast for her senses.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing in Key West, you can often get a lot done in a little bit of time. After an early check in to Oceans Edge Resort and a mid day departure from then dock, Ali looks to Rush to put him on an afternoon bite of tuna and bottom fish that few other places can offer. If Rush is going to deliver, he will need to make a plan and stick to it to make the best use of this limited time.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: For Ali and Rush, one of the best aspects of fishing is being able to share experiences on the water with interesting people. On this episode we invite luxury watch enthusiast Eric Rivera - AKA "Watch Eric" to the Florida Keys to target Permit and Amberjack in the Gulf.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Featuring Capt. Sammy Millazo Fishing Offshore Islamorada.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: From Miami to Apalachicola Bay, Florida, Capt. Jonathan Moss revisits some of his favorite moments from this season.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Lake Vermilion is home to some amazing fishing opportunities with crappies being one of them!

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss travels to Melbourne, on Floridas Space Coast, to cast flies with Capt. Noah Miler at some unforgettable fish.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We follow along as a decommissioned ship is sunk to create a new artificial reef, much to the delight of divers and anglers. Plus, Adapt-Able SCUBA makes underwater adventure possible for those who didnt think it was.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: A beautiful beach day and confident anglers is the perfect scenario to prove tarpon never play by the rules. Justin & Meredith get a dose of tarpon psychology and begin to second guess their angling skills.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin and Meredith return to the chase after taking a lesson from finicky tarpon. This time, they pay close attention to how hooks and presentations affect their odds of a strike.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justins boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the worlds luckiest fish.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisianas only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his familys traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, hell meet plenty of farmers and foragersharvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger meet up with Capt. Brain Wilson in Galveston, TX for a taste of what the Texas Gulf Coast has to offer.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger join Capt. Brain Wilson in Galveston, TX for some hot Red Snapper action.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger go north for a change to sight fish tripletails in Florida Bay.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger head to the hump on a windy day to target tunas and find some bonus mahis and tripletails as well.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Being consistently productive on the water means knowing how to adapt to conditions. Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger switch it up and fish shallow for sailfish.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Capt. Scott Walker and Capt. Steve Rodger launch from the incomparable Oceans Edge Resort in Key West, Florida to hunt down all kinds of sport fish.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: In rural Wisconsin, we follow the Yackley family who has dedicated their lives to competitive shooting. The five-member crew is the most decorated family in shooting sports. Becky Yackley gives tips to new shooters and then teams up with Chris Keefer to review Winchester USA Ready.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over 70 years ago, John Olin took 600 acres of farmland joined by timber and turned it into a wildlife oasis in hopes of creating an ideal place to raise and train the best Labradors Retrievers in the country. He called it Nilo, which was also Olins model of conservation. Today, Nilo is still considered one of the most prestigious hunting and shooting preserves in the nation. This is the story of Nilo.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of the game changing 350 Legend cartridge is documented at deer camps across the midwest with the Keefer Brothers in Kansas, Mark and Terry Drury in Missouri, Melissa Bachman in Nebraska and Team Winchester back in Missouri.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The collaboration story between Winchester and Browning to create the groundbreaking 6.8 Western is featured. Tag along on a mule deer hunt in Utah with Chris Keefer and Winchesters Jason Gilbertson, then follow Casey Keefer to Colorado for elk and Nebraska for whitetail where the 6.8 Western is put to the test.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared and Father-Son duo Captains Hunter & Chris Barron have Sailfish in their sights.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared travels to Venice, Louisiana, where the Mississippi River meets the Gulf, joining Capt. Garrett George and Capt. Jesse Leboeuf for an action-packed offshore adventure in pursuit of Redfish and Tuna.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared joins his best new bud, Capt. Garrett George for a summertime Mahi bash.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Jared's teams up with long time friend and fellow guide, Capt. Greg Dini, to conquer the patch reef.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer seasons past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Its been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the worlds best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchesters best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. Well also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: In this episode the DCD crew heads to the lesser-known but highly productive Red River in Western Louisiana. Despite a slow start to the season, the Red River provides some of the best hunting yet. With mixed bags of woodies, greenheads, and teal. Not to mention a handful of bonus squirrels and wild mushrooms. Shoot straight and come hungry.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Duck hunting in Louisiana is as much about its history as it is about its future. In the season's final days, Jean-Paul learns about Louisianas rich waterfowling history, dives into conservation projects throughout the state, and returns to Bayou Black for one last ride. Shoot straight and come hungry because it's the last hunt of the season.

programme.desc: Brandon fishes an insane grouper bite with his good buddy from Sodium Fishing Gear.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: Most people think of it as a sewer, but the Los Angeles River is just like any other river: a vital natural habitat that must be protected and revitalized. Through the eyes of local fly fishermen and women, as well as a local infrastructure agent, and members of a non-profit focused on the LA River, we see the waterway in a new light, as it is revealed that sections of the river are loaded with fish, ducks, and other wildlife.

programme.title: Rivers are Life
programme.desc: One of the most iconic rivers in the world, the Nile has been fished for thousands of years, but in recent decades fishing has nearly halted in many areas due to plastic clogging the river. VeryNile launched the Reviving Cairo Fishermen project, which empowers local fishermen and women to clean the Nile, removing almost 40 tons of plastic per year. The plastic they collect is then turned into sellable products, completing a circular economy that benefits the entire community.

programme.title: Operation Healing Heroes
programme.desc: Shot through the neck on Fort Hood in Texas, Green Beret John Arroyo recounts coming face to face with his attacker and Jesus blinding his would be killer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over 70 years ago, John Olin took 600 acres of farmland joined by timber and turned it into a wildlife oasis in hopes of creating an ideal place to raise and train the best Labradors Retrievers in the country. He called it Nilo, which was also Olins model of conservation. Today, Nilo is still considered one of the most prestigious hunting and shooting preserves in the nation. This is the story of Nilo.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike heads to Crystal river to chase Redfish in his new Cayo Skiff.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike fished for shallow water Grouper with Capt. Brandon Branch and Mike Bedenbaugh.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike Fishes a very special Tarpon tournament out of South Seas Island Resort.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike Fishes with long time friend Erick Bachnik, from MirrOlure, deep inside the Manatee River for Giant Snook.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: The season finale, where we take a look at all the highlights of the season and some of our favorite moments.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Blair and Leiza Fitzgerrald search the Indian River Lagoon for redfish to tag for the CCA STAR Tournament.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Hunter Bach takes Blair to the northern part of the Indian River to catch redfish.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair heads out of Cape Canaveral with an old friend Capt. Scott Lum looking for triple tail and Cobia.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Odyssea Sportfishing family grows as Casey Villone comes aboard as Rush's new deck hand. While Rush gained a helping hand on his charters, he also scored a new "Fishing Mate" who is always game to bend a rod. With a day off and a report of Tuna offshore, the two head out to see if they can beat the sharks and land a Key West sushi dinner.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush teams up with longtime friend and fellow angler Jesus Diaz for a well-earned "busman's holiday" in the beautiful waters of Key West. Even on a day off, these two can't resist seeing what's going to bite. Taking the wind and the tides into account, the duo maps out a strategic circuit through Key West's surrounding waters to target cobia, grouper, snapper, and tuna for a busy day "off" work.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Water quality is everythingand the Star brite - SeaSafe team is back at it for the second year in a row! Led by Cory Redwine, Conservation Director of Project SeaSafe, this is the 4th Annual Clean Water Collective and its bigger than ever. This time, were in Grant, Florida, where 4 million clams are being released into the Indian River Lagoon, paired with the planting of thousands of mangroves, oyster work by CCA and trash clean ups to help restore one of Floridas most critical ecosystems. But its not just about hard workits about connection. With local captains, fishing legends, and the Local Knowledge crew on hand, we hit the water to show why this place is worth fighting for. From clam drops by drone, to in-water mangrove planting, to monster snook catches, this is hands-on conservation at its best. This two-part series kicks off with action, heart, and the kind of hope only a healthy waterway can bring. Dont miss Part 1where conservation meets community and everyone gets their hands wet.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As part of this year's Star brite Sea Safe event, we hit the water to experience some of the incredible fishing the Indian River Lagoon has to offer. For Rush, that meant some serious bow time with close friend Alex Hughey - on the hunt for some of the biggest snook we've ever encountered. The bite wasn't easy, but that didn't stop Rush from smashing his personal best - not once, but twice - in one unforgettable day on the water. Don't miss this action-packed episode of the Sea Safe adventure from beautiful Sebastian, Florida!

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: The BaitFuel Fishing Tour kicks off its season in Quinte West, Ontario where the teams will fish this Largemouth Bass Only event on the water of the Bay of Quinte.

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: Qualifier 2 for the BaitFuel Fishing Tour is back in Quinte West, Ontario where the teams will fish this Largemouth Bass Only event on the water of the Bay of Quinte.

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: Qualifier 3 finds the tour anglers headed to the St. Lawrence River out of Brockville, Ontario.

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: This week the teams descend upon Cornwall, Ontario for Qualifier 4 to fish Lake St. Francis for back to back events over the weekend.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela explores the model for community conservation in the Zambezi Delta of Mozambique, and responsibly harvests a Cape Buffalo bull on their behalf.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela learns about the recovery of an icon and the role that utilization has played in bringing a species back from the brink - the American Bison.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela joins the relocation of one of Africas most endangered Big Cats to an ecosystem where they have been absent for almost 100 years. Also known as the fastest land mammal - the Cheetah.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela explains the domestic trade in exotic wildlife and how some of our planets most threatened species are being protected by the practice.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin entices a friend to play hooky from work to set hooks offshore on a perfect locals day. The only thing better than the weather was the dinner they caught and cooked.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Witness a truly epic day on the water when Capt. Justin and Meredith find a secluded slice of beach teeming with redfish biting virtually everything. Topwater plugs, rusty flies and a live well full of bait make for an experience no redfish angler would forget

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When your gut tells you to do something different than whats in front of you, do you listen?Capt. Justin and Meredith listen, and find that success comes in many forms. And it turns out that success can be really tasty, too!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Its opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexicos most popular fish?

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Join Rush and his good friend Anthony Solmo for an epic day of fishing in the stunning waters of Key West, Florida! Leaving the Odyssea at the dock, they hop on a bay boat outfitted with a trolling motor for the ultimate inshore adventure. Gliding quietly through the shallows, they target a variety of speciesincluding hard-pulling Tarpon and explosive topwater Jacksleaving Rush thinking, A guy could get used to this kind of fishing!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: SoCal summer is calling, and the Local Knowledge crew is back on Alis home turf in San Diego, California. With reports of hot bites and fish moving in, the crew faces a classic Southern California dilemma chase big yellowtail around the Coronado Islands or head north in search of bluefin tuna. The options are plenty, the challenges are real, and thats exactly what keeps fishing in SoCal so exciting.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When the yellowtail at the islands refuse to play, its time to switch up the game plan. Ali and Rush pivot north of San Diego in search of hard-charging bluefin tuna during a multi-day mission aboard the 43 custom ACI Catamaran "Killer Bee". Armed with the right crew, the right gear, and a never-quit mindset, the guys roll the dice on an overnight movehoping to wake up to redemption and put a few quality bluefin on deck.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Returning to Venice, Louisiana for the first time in nearly a decade, Rush reconnects with longtime friends Eric and Monique Newman of Journey South Outfitters for an unforgettable inshore fishing adventure in the heart of the Mississippi River Delta. With reports of massive schools of redfish cruising the beaches, Monique (Moe) must decide whether to trust the intel and make a bold run down the coastor rely on her own instincts built from years on the water. The mission is simple: put Rush on a true bull redfish and see if he has what it takes to earn a spot in her coveted Over 40-Inch Club. This trip highlights why Venice, Louisiana is considered one of the premier inshore fisheries in the countryand why having the right guide makes all the difference. Target Species: Bull Redfish. Location: Venice, Louisiana Mississippi Delta. Outfitter: Journey South Outfitters.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Everyone knows Colorado for its epic mountains and fresh powder. But on this episode of DIRT, were digging into the unexpected side of the state (UFO rumors and all). Whether surfing infinite river waves, cultivating perfect carrot seeds, or fly fishing in downtown Denvers shadowgeeky passions run high. Follow along as we gather ingredients for a farm to table final feast equal parts foraged, free-range, and free-thinking.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: On this episode of Huckberry Homes, we headed out to far west Texas to meet up with our friend and Home Builder Kyle Melgaard. Over the last 5 years, Kyle and his crew at Method Building Co. have created custom and lasting spaces that compliment the vast landscape of the West Texas desert. Kyle showed us a day in his life, taking us to an active job site that he calls an office, and showcasing his unique Rammed Earth style house that him and his family call home.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Florida Keys guide Jeff Malone to find a productive wreck with which they enjoy the exciting variety of fish that wrecks can provide.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by marine scientist Nick Castillo to search for bonefish in Key Largo for both fun and study.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor take a trip to the Marathon, FL area to challenge some feisty sharks and sneaky snook.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head offshore to the Marathon Hump, taking advantage of the 26-feet hybrid boat's versatility to find some exciting Blackfin and Skipjack Tuna fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by scientist Nick Haddad, who educates our hosts and the fishing world on the various descending devices used to preserve stressed catch from deeper waters as the three of them get into some fun Red Snapper fishing off the coast of Marathon, Florida in the Keys.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Rich's son Reed, who takes the wheel and directs the team into some amazing early morning baby tarpon fishing in the Everglades.

programme.title: Sail Kings
programme.desc: Featuring Capt. Jack Given & The Fish For Holly Crew Championship Style!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: For Ali and Rush, one of the best aspects of fishing is being able to share experiences on the water with interesting people. On this episode we invite luxury watch enthusiast Eric Rivera - AKA "Watch Eric" to the Florida Keys to target Permit and Amberjack in the Gulf.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing in Key West, you can often get a lot done in a little bit of time. After an early check in to Oceans Edge Resort and a mid day departure from then dock, Ali looks to Rush to put him on an afternoon bite of tuna and bottom fish that few other places can offer. If Rush is going to deliver, he will need to make a plan and stick to it to make the best use of this limited time.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: For Ali and Rush, one of the best aspects of fishing is being able to share experiences on the water with interesting people. On this episode we invite luxury watch enthusiast Eric Rivera - AKA "Watch Eric" to the Florida Keys to target Permit and Amberjack in the Gulf.

programme.desc: From Miami to Apalachicola Bay, Florida, Capt. Jonathan Moss revisits some of his favorite moments from this season.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Lake Vermilion is home to some amazing fishing opportunities with crappies being one of them!

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss travels to Melbourne, on Floridas Space Coast, to cast flies with Capt. Noah Miler at some unforgettable fish.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We follow along as a decommissioned ship is sunk to create a new artificial reef, much to the delight of divers and anglers. Plus, Adapt-Able SCUBA makes underwater adventure possible for those who didnt think it was.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: A beautiful beach day and confident anglers is the perfect scenario to prove tarpon never play by the rules. Justin & Meredith get a dose of tarpon psychology and begin to second guess their angling skills.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin and Meredith return to the chase after taking a lesson from finicky tarpon. This time, they pay close attention to how hooks and presentations affect their odds of a strike.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justins boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the worlds luckiest fish.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisianas only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his familys traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, hell meet plenty of farmers and foragersharvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Winchester Life

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The collaboration story between Winchester and Browning to create the groundbreaking 6.8 Western is featured. programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer seasons past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.desc: Blair and Leiza Fitzgerrald search the Indian River Lagoon for redfish to tag for the CCA STAR Tournament.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Hunter Bach takes Blair to the northern part of the Indian River to catch redfish.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair heads out of Cape Canaveral with an old friend Capt. Scott Lum looking for triple tail and Cobia.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Odyssea Sportfishing family grows as Casey Villone comes aboard as Rush's new deck hand. While Rush gained a helping hand on his charters, he also scored a new "Fishing Mate" who is always game to bend a rod. With a day off and a report of Tuna offshore, the two head out to see if they can beat the sharks and land a Key West sushi dinner.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Rush teams up with longtime friend and fellow angler Jesus Diaz for a well-earned "busman's holiday" in the beautiful waters of Key West. Even on a day off, these two can't resist seeing what's going to bite. Taking the wind and the tides into account, the duo maps out a strategic circuit through Key West's surrounding waters to target cobia, grouper, snapper, and tuna for a busy day "off" work.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Water quality is everythingand the Star brite - SeaSafe team is back at it for the second year in a row! Led by Cory Redwine, Conservation Director of Project SeaSafe, this is the 4th Annual Clean Water Collective and its bigger than ever. This time, were in Grant, Florida, where 4 million clams are being released into the Indian River Lagoon, paired with the planting of thousands of mangroves, oyster work by CCA and trash clean ups to help restore one of Floridas most critical ecosystems. But its not just about hard workits about connection. With local captains, fishing legends, and the Local Knowledge crew on hand, we hit the water to show why this place is worth fighting for. From clam drops by drone, to in-water mangrove planting, to monster snook catches, this is hands-on conservation at its best. This two-part series kicks off with action, heart, and the kind of hope only a healthy waterway can bring. Dont miss Part 1where conservation meets community and everyone gets their hands wet.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As part of this year's Star brite Sea Safe event, we hit the water to experience some of the incredible fishing the Indian River Lagoon has to offer. For Rush, that meant some serious bow time with close friend Alex Hughey - on the hunt for some of the biggest snook we've ever encountered. The bite wasn't easy, but that didn't stop Rush from smashing his personal best - not once, but twice - in one unforgettable day on the water. Don't miss this action-packed episode of the Sea Safe adventure from beautiful Sebastian, Florida!

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: The BaitFuel Fishing Tour kicks off its season in Quinte West, Ontario where the teams will fish this Largemouth Bass Only event on the water of the Bay of Quinte.

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: Qualifier 2 for the BaitFuel Fishing Tour is back in Quinte West, Ontario where the teams will fish this Largemouth Bass Only event on the water of the Bay of Quinte.

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: Qualifier 3 finds the tour anglers headed to the St. Lawrence River out of Brockville, Ontario.

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: This week the teams descend upon Cornwall, Ontario for Qualifier 4 to fish Lake St. Francis for back to back events over the weekend.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela explores the model for community conservation in the Zambezi Delta of Mozambique, and responsibly harvests a Cape Buffalo bull on their behalf.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela learns about the recovery of an icon and the role that utilization has played in bringing a species back from the brink - the American Bison.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela joins the relocation of one of Africas most endangered Big Cats to an ecosystem where they have been absent for almost 100 years. Also known as the fastest land mammal - the Cheetah.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela explains the domestic trade in exotic wildlife and how some of our planets most threatened species are being protected by the practice.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin entices a friend to play hooky from work to set hooks offshore on a perfect locals day. The only thing better than the weather was the dinner they caught and cooked.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Witness a truly epic day on the water when Capt. Justin and Meredith find a secluded slice of beach teeming with redfish biting virtually everything. Topwater plugs, rusty flies and a live well full of bait make for an experience no redfish angler would forget

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When your gut tells you to do something different than whats in front of you, do you listen?Capt. Justin and Meredith listen, and find that success comes in many forms. And it turns out that success can be really tasty, too!

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Its opening day of grouper season and, for Capt. Justin Leake and one of his longtime fishing buddies, that means a trip offshore is in order. And what better way to break in a new boat than heading to some reefs and filling the cooler with one of the Gulf of Mexicos most popular fish?

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Join Rush and his good friend Anthony Solmo for an epic day of fishing in the stunning waters of Key West, Florida! Leaving the Odyssea at the dock, they hop on a bay boat outfitted with a trolling motor for the ultimate inshore adventure. Gliding quietly through the shallows, they target a variety of speciesincluding hard-pulling Tarpon and explosive topwater Jacksleaving Rush thinking, A guy could get used to this kind of fishing!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: SoCal summer is calling, and the Local Knowledge crew is back on Alis home turf in San Diego, California. With reports of hot bites and fish moving in, the crew faces a classic Southern California dilemma chase big yellowtail around the Coronado Islands or head north in search of bluefin tuna. The options are plenty, the challenges are real, and thats exactly what keeps fishing in SoCal so exciting.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When the yellowtail at the islands refuse to play, its time to switch up the game plan. Ali and Rush pivot north of San Diego in search of hard-charging bluefin tuna during a multi-day mission aboard the 43 custom ACI Catamaran "Killer Bee". Armed with the right crew, the right gear, and a never-quit mindset, the guys roll the dice on an overnight movehoping to wake up to redemption and put a few quality bluefin on deck.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Returning to Venice, Louisiana for the first time in nearly a decade, Rush reconnects with longtime friends Eric and Monique Newman of Journey South Outfitters for an unforgettable inshore fishing adventure in the heart of the Mississippi River Delta. With reports of massive schools of redfish cruising the beaches, Monique (Moe) must decide whether to trust the intel and make a bold run down the coastor rely on her own instincts built from years on the water. The mission is simple: put Rush on a true bull redfish and see if he has what it takes to earn a spot in her coveted Over 40-Inch Club. This trip highlights why Venice, Louisiana is considered one of the premier inshore fisheries in the countryand why having the right guide makes all the difference. Target Species: Bull Redfish. Location: Venice, Louisiana Mississippi Delta. Outfitter: Journey South Outfitters.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Everyone knows Colorado for its epic mountains and fresh powder. But on this episode of DIRT, were digging into the unexpected side of the state (UFO rumors and all). Whether surfing infinite river waves, cultivating perfect carrot seeds, or fly fishing in downtown Denvers shadowgeeky passions run high. Follow along as we gather ingredients for a farm to table final feast equal parts foraged, free-range, and free-thinking.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: On this episode of Huckberry Homes, we headed out to far west Texas to meet up with our friend and Home Builder Kyle Melgaard. Over the last 5 years, Kyle and his crew at Method Building Co. have created custom and lasting spaces that compliment the vast landscape of the West Texas desert. Kyle showed us a day in his life, taking us to an active job site that he calls an office, and showcasing his unique Rammed Earth style house that him and his family call home.

Over the course of an extensive trial, Biegler parries with District Attorney Lodwick (Brooks West) and out-of-town prosecutor Claude Dancer (George C. When Theodora goes to New York to visit her publisher (Thurston Hall), she meets the book's cover artist, Michael Grant (Melvyn Douglas), who tries to convince her to reveal herself as the real author. When Theodora falls for Michael, she soon finds that he has secrets of his own.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: The team must help an injured former Secret Service agent regain his memory in order to stop the launching of weapons of mass destruction.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A kidnapped woman misdials a cell-phone number and begs for help, and the team must figure out the number and person she was trying to call.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team has a long list of suspects, including a victim's wife, a magician and a captain, as members search for the killer of two people on a cruise ship docked in Miami.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A spoiled heiress is found dead in her bathtub during her own party, with no shortage of suspects; Horatio tells Delko that he and Marisol plan to wed as soon as possible.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team is on the verge of putting away members of the Mala Noche gang, but the gang's planned hit on Horatio endangers the lives of those close to him.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio mourns the murder of someone close to him as he and the team hunt for the killer; the revelation of the mole's identity jeopardizes the future of the lab.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team discovers a Russian spy ring hiding on Oahu when a Russian submarine appears off the coast.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: After McGarrett's CIA agent friend is killed, he lets himself be captured by the group he thinks is responsible to find the killer; Tani questions whether she should tell McGarrett about the murder weapon she found at Adam's house.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a vacationing father on a flight to Honolulu is kidnapped and forced to parachute midflight, Danny, Tani and Junior track him through the jungle to discover that he may not be who he seems; McGarrett is threatened with a secret from his past.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A heat wave hits Oahu, contributing to a spike in crime; McGarrett and Danny hunt down a bank thief; Tani and Junior's car is stolen while they're on duty; Kamekona incites a riot by price-gouging his ice.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Jerry accompanies Junior as he escorts a fallen soldier home to Oahu; McGarrett and Danny discover a body when they delve into the highly profitable black market for sand.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: On Halloween, Jerry and his friends search his childhood camp for evidence to a murder he witnessed as a boy; McGarrett investigates a little girl who drew pictures depicting the scene of a recent murder before it was discovered.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett crosses the line and is arrested while investigating the death of his former SEAL buddy who died while making an emergency landing on an aircraft carrier; Adam returns to Oahu with devastating news about his marriage.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: McGarrett investigates a cold case that his grandfather and the famous Honolulu detective Chang Apana worked on in the 1940s; McGarrett and Danny get ready for the opening of their restaurant.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When DCI Barnaby and DS Troy arrive in the sleepy village of Badger's Drift to investigate the sudden death of elderly Miss Emily Simpson, her next door neighbour insists that she had been murdered, after she had seen her return from a walk in the woods, unnerved and shocked by something she had witnessed. When the post mortem confirms her death was no accident, the pair discover that nothing is what it seems to be within the little village as they try to find out what exactly she saw. Their investigation introduces Barnaby and Troy to many eccentric and quirky residents and soon turns up a web of sex, blackmail and lies, and the possibility that the murder could be connected to a shooting accident two years ago, which claimed another woman's life.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: After debating on who their next guest speaker should be, the Midsomer Worthy Writers' Circle decide to invite famous writer, Max Jennings, to their next meeting, despite opposition to the choice by Gerald Hadleigh, the group's chairman. When Hadleigh is found dead the day after Jennings visit, brutally bludgeoned and stripped naked, Barnaby and Troy discover that the victim had many mysteries to him, prompting them to delve into his private life and his past. Matters soon become complicated when Jennings disappears and is later found dead, and a witness recalls seeing a mysterious woman in Hadleigh's house the night before his murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Whilst investigating the murder of Agnes Gray, a quiet animal-loving woman who was bludgeoned to death and found floating in a river near to the village of Ferne Basset, Barnaby gets more than he bargained for when he attends his wife's performance in the Causton Amateur Dramatics' production of Amadeus. When Agnes's cousin, Esslyn Carmichael, inadvertently cuts his own throat during the final act, it's quickly discovered that the tape on the prop blade he had used was removed without anyone knowing. The detective is left wondering who had wanted to turn Esslyn's final act into a true coup de theatre, as he and Troy try to determine what the motive was behind the two murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Local villagers in Morton Fendle are up in arms, demanding answers from Alan Hollingsworth, the owner of a local craft centre they had invested in, after news comes out that it has recently fallen into financial turmoil. As tensions begin rising in the village, Barnaby soon suspects that something has happened to Alan's wife, Simone, when his behaviour suddenly changes. His suspicions are soon confirmed when it transpires that Simone was kidnapped, after one of Alan's neighbours is murdered, shortly after witnessing something they shouldn't have.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Bill Carter, one of the founders of a local New Age commune called the Lodge of the Golden Windhorse, dies suddenly after falling down some stairs and breaking his neck. Although there was uncertainty as to whether it was the result of an accident or murder, Barnaby and Troy find themselves having to determine which it was, when Ian Craigie, the commune's leader, is stabbed to death with a carving knife a few days later, while attending a spiritual seance with the rest of the commune and the parents of one of its members. It's not long before they discover hidden truths about the commune's founding and some of its members.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Plans by Barnaby to renew his wedding vows at the church of St Michael's in Badger's Drift, are quickly put on hold when the body of Richard Bayly, a local developer, is found decapitated in his own home. The detective is left mystified as to why anyone would kill a man who had only been given weeks to live, after being recently diagnosed with a brain tumour. As he and Troy attempt to find out, they soon encounter a hotbed of corruption and property feuding occurring within the village as the body count rises and the mystery deepens.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Carla Constanza - the face of Brazil's leading cigarette brand for Monarch Tobacco - is found strangled in the infamous Strangler's Wood, Barnaby and Troy not only find themselves investigating her murder, but three identical unsolved murders of innocent girls from eight years before.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Cully's latest boyfriend, Nico, decides to shadow Troy in preparation for a TV role he recently got, but gets more hands-on experience than he expected when investigations into a slashed painting at a museum in Aspern Tallow, a 17th century portrait of Royalist Jonathan Lowrie, are overshadowed by the murder of his descendant, Marcus Lowrie. It isn't long before Barnaby and Troy, with Nico's assistance, find themselves dealing with mysterious, ghostly events, escaped criminals, and a museum trustee who has more to them than meets the eye.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Hector Bridges, a local magistrate, is infuriated when one of his geese is stolen, just as two bands of travellers arrive in Martyr Warren. Although Barnaby and Troy are called in to deal with the theft and later dissuade him from forcefully evicting the travellers from the village, they soon have a murder on their hands, when a short while later Bridges is killed with his own shotgun. It quickly transpires that many in the village had hated the magistrate, who lied, bullied, and committed many an injustice, leaving the detectives determined to find who among them had pulled the trigger after Bridges pushed them past their breaking point.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When MATTHEW DRAPER, a quarry worker is killed by a demolition charge after obeying the orders of his foreman, IAN FRASER, to return to the unexploded device, no one can predict how it might effect the tranquil village of Fletcher's Cross nine years later...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby's aunt, Alice Bly (Phyllis Calvert), has an addiction to detective stories, a deep admiration for her favourite nephew, and is recovering from an operation at the Lawnside Nursing Home. When a resident dies, Alice Bly picks up gossip which, mixed with the detective fiction with which she is passing the hours, makes her think that all is not as it should be at Lawnside.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The village of Midsomer Mallow is one of the villages hoping to win the title of the "Perfect English Village" competition. As the story unfolds, not everything is "perfect" as local thief Peter Drinkwater is stabbed with a pitchfork at an abandoned farm, he's using as a squat. Shortly after robbing a retired actor's home. Despite the villagers' best efforts to keep the murder quiet so as to not ruin their chances in the competition, several further deaths occur eventually bringing Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby back several decades to uncover the killer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Whilst the Upper Marshwood hunt assemble outside the village inn, a filthy tramp-like man leaves the shop and skulks into the wood. Soon after, he hears the sound of the hunt begin and the unforgettable noise of the horses and hounds in hot pursuit of the fox. Running for cover, towards the safety of his home-made shelter, he stumbles and falls into a pit - screaming. LIZA, isolated in the disused railway carriage which constitutes her home, moves deeper into the wood having heard the scream. She finds the pit and sees the tramp lying crumpled on the ground, clearly dead. She stares at him for a moment, then turns and walks away.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The closing of what was once a very popular public garden in Midsomer Deverell sparks a series of murders that have Inspector Barnaby and Sgt. Troy stumped.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the funeral of local hotelier Karl Wainwright, his hotel's manager and a well liked Punch and Judy performer, Gregory Chambers, disappears unusually in yet another picturesque Midsomer village. Most people dismiss his disappearance completely but when he doesn't turn up, a search is conducted and a severed hand, confirmed to be Gregory's, turns up in the woods. Further deaths and a mushroom poisoning occur surrounding the beneficiaries of Karl Wainwright's will. All is not as it seems.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A man's naked body found under mysterious circumstances, within a crop circle on Sir Harry Chatwyn's wheat field, leads police to investigating how he wound up in the field after being electrocuted. While the nearby village of Midsomer Parva is abuzz with UFO mania, Barnaby is unconvinced by a local ufologist that the man's death was the result of alien activity, as he uncovers rivalries, theft and hatred during his investigations, soon after a well known burglar is found dead in another crop circle with identical injuries.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Returning home one night, in a drunken state, the local doctor of Newton Magna calls in the police after he had accidentally hit a man, yet when Barnaby and Troy arrive, the injured man is nowhere to be found. As they investigate the mystery, Barnaby encounters an old adversary who is working to help renovate the village and whose daughter is getting married to a local boy. Matters soon become complicated, when the body of the best man's father is found in a well that was being renovated, whom the detectives soon discover had disappeared on the day he was planning to run away with a local farmer's wife.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Dave Cutler, Goodman's Land's amorous postman, is found almost decapitated near the common early one morning. Newspaper girl Holly Reid (Kate Maberly) tells Barnaby that she heard music playing faintly nearby. Barnaby and Troy are aided in their investigations by local WPC Jay Nash (Gillian Kearney).

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is killed after receiving threatening letters, setting off a chain of murders for DCI Barnaby to investigate.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the village of Midsomer Wellow, someone is killing off the bell ringers of the parish church, in the week before a big bell-ringing competition. One young woman on the team is even shot dead in the churchyard on her wedding day.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Some of the residents of Midsomer Worthy are trying to prevent James Harrington from turning Setwale Woods into a housing estate. Led by a solicitor, Bernadette Sullivan, and a local farmer, Simon Bartlett, who also happen to be having an affair, they haven't had much success in court. When Bartlett's wife Victoria is found dead in the woods, Barnaby and Troy must first determine is if her murder is related to the planned development or something as yet unknown. The information provided by two inquisitive children, who see the investigation as a fascinating game, proves invaluable in solving the crime.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An investigation of a car fire and a bludgeon murder lead Barnaby and Troy to investigate the members of a local reading club which has an agenda that goes beyond books.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby investigates the murder of a boy during a traditional annual race at an exclusive private school but meets with resentment.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The double murder of eccentric widow, Isobel Hewitt, and adulterous doctor, Duncan Goff, lead Barnaby and Troy into finding out more about their personal and private lives in the village of Malham Bridge. While Troy suspects an antique dealer that Isobel befriended is the culprit, Barnaby is not convinced, believing anyone the victims knew when they were alive could have been the murderer, from the doctor's wife to the local owner of a restaurant. Even Isobel's close family and members of a local fly fishing group are suspects as they investigate all possible angles.

programme.title: Killer Performance
